description:
go1intro: first draft of the go1 overview doc
This is heavily edited version of the Go 1 preview doc.
It remains drafty.

Fixes issue 3086.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

This is much longer than what I would have expected to read, with much duplication of what is already covered elsewhere. I would prefer a much shorter document; 3/4 page perhaps, with links instead. We are not in danger of not enough documentation here, I think, it's the opposite. http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html File doc/go1intro.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode14 doc/go1intro.html:14: This document outlines the reasons behind Go 1 and outlines its major differences outlines 2x http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode38 doc/go1intro.html:38: Our goal was for Go 1 to be a stable version of today's Go, not a wholesale rethinking of the language. At this point I read "stable" about 5 times (lines 22, 28, 33, 33, 38). This is too much repetition. I think this can be shortened. http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode59 doc/go1intro.html:59:

Language

I find this is too much duplication of what's already outlined in the go1.html document. Is this really needed? Can't we just enumerate the changes as links to that document instead? http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode155 doc/go1intro.html:155: defined internally as, s/internally// (it already says predeclared)

On 22/02/2012, at 6:13 PM, gri@golang.org wrote:

> This is much longer than what I would have expected to read, with much
> duplication of what is already covered elsewhere. I would prefer a much
> shorter document; 3/4 page perhaps, with links instead.
> 
> We are not in danger of not enough documentation here, I think, it's the
> opposite.

that's a fair criticism and one i had in mind. the issue is that there is no justification written down about why the various changes were made. maybe we don't need to justify, and just do.

one possibility is to keep the intro and summarize the rest with links.

another is to move the intro into the release notes.

another is to have a blog post and drop this altogether.

-rob

On Tue, Feb 21, 2012 at 8:16 PM, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> fixes issue 3086
>
> when will we reach 8086?
>

I'm holding down turbo button... not long.

Some small suggestions. http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html File doc/go1intro.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode287 doc/go1intro.html:287: A common mistake is to use return (without arguments) after an assignment to a variable that has the same name as a result variable but is not the result variable.] extra ] ? http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode411 doc/go1intro.html:411: timepackage that need a space between "time" and "package". http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode438 doc/go1intro.html:438: The Go 1 release will be available in source and binary form for at least these platforms: should this section be named something like "Binary Distributions" http://codereview.appspot.com/5685076/diff/6001/doc/go1intro.html#newcode452 doc/go1intro.html:452: FreeBSD 7+ amd64, 386, arm Not FreeBSD/ARM, but Linux/ARM.

I know we've said that go1.tmpl has no motivation, but maybe
we should relax that to having no motivation for the "minor package
changes" sections and merge the motivation stuff (for the language
changes and major package changes) from this doc into that one?

Russ
